name: Democratic Republic of the Congo
name_long: The Democratic Republic of the Congo
introduction: Established as an official Belgian colony in 1908 the then-Republic of the Congo gained its independence in 1960 but its early years were marred by political and social instability. Col. Joseph MOBUTU seized power and declared himself president in a November 1965 coup. He subsequently changed his name - to MOBUTU Sese Seko - as well as that of the country - to Zaire. MOBUTU retained his position for 32 years through several sham elections as well as through brutal force. Ethnic strife and civil war touched off by a massive inflow of refugees in 1994 from fighting in Rwanda and Burundi led in May 1997 to the toppling of the MOBUTU regime by a rebellion backed by Rwanda and Uganda and fronted by Laurent KABILA. He renamed the country the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) but in August 1998 his regime was itself challenged by a second insurrection again backed by Rwanda and Uganda. Troops from Angola Chad Namibia Sudan and Zimbabwe intervened to support KABILA's regime. In January 2001 KABILA was assassinated and his son Joseph KABILA was named head of state. In October 2002 the new president was successful in negotiating the withdrawal of Rwandan forces occupying the eastern DRC; two months later the Pretoria Accord was signed by all remaining warring parties to end the fighting and establish a government of national unity. A transitional government was set up in July 2003; it held a successful constitutional referendum in December 2005 and elections for the presidency National Assembly and provincial legislatures took place in 2006. ++ In 2009 following a resurgence of conflict in the eastern DRC the government signed a peace agreement with the National Congress for the Defense of the People (CNDP) a primarily Tutsi rebel group. An attempt to integrate CNDP members into the Congolese military failed prompting their defection in 2012 and the formation of the M23 armed group - named after the 23 March 2009 peace agreements. Renewed conflict led to large population displacements and significant human rights abuses before the M23 was pushed out of DRC to Uganda and Rwanda in late 2013 by a joint DRC and UN offensive. In addition the DRC continues to experience violence committed by other armed groups including the Democratic Forces for the Liberation of Rwanda the Allied Democratic Forces and assorted Mai Mai militias. In the most recent national elections held in November 2011 disputed results allowed Joseph KABILA to be reelected to the presidency; the next presidential election is scheduled for late 2016.
overview: The Democratic Republic of the Congo also known as DR Congo the DRC Congo-Kinshasa or simply the Congo is a country located in Central Africa. It is sometimes referred to by its former name of Zaire which was its official name between 1971 and 1997. The DRC borders the Central African Republic and South Sudan to the north; Uganda Rwanda Burundi and Tanzania to the east; Zambia to the south; Angola to the southwest; and the Republic of the Congo and the Atlantic Ocean to the west. It is the second-largest country in Africa after Algeria (the largest in Sub-Saharan Africa) by area and the 11th-largest in the world.

languages.name: Ngelima
languages.area: Orientale Province, Banalia and Basoko territories.

languages.name: Portuguese
languages.area: Iberia, Azores, Madeira. Also in Andorra, Angola, Antigua and Barbuda, Belgium, Bermuda, Brazil, Canada, Cape Verde Islands, China, Congo, East Timor, France, Germany, Guinea-Bissau, Guyana, India, Indonesia (Nusa Tenggara), Jamaica, Luxembourg, Malawi, Mozambique, Netherlands Antilles, Oman, Paraguay, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, São Tomé e Príncipe, Senegal, South Africa, Spain, Suriname, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United States, Uruguay, Venezuela, Zambia.

languages.name: Pelende
languages.area: Bandundu Province, Kenge Territory.

languages.name: Ruund
languages.area: Katanga Province, Lualaba District. Also in Angola.

languages.name: Amba (Uganda)
languages.area: Democratic Republic of the Congo border area south of Lake Albert, Beni District, Watalinga and Bawisa subcounties; Ruwenzori Mountains, Bundibugyo District. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Sango
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Chad, Congo, Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Sonde
languages.area: Southeast Bandundu Province, Feshi Territory.

languages.name: Shi
languages.area: Sud-Kivu Province, north, west, and south of Bukavu.

languages.name: Sakata
languages.area: Bandundu Province, Kutu, Mushie, and Inongo territories, Lukenie River, and Semendua area.

languages.name: Salampasu
languages.area: Southeast Kasaï Occidental Province, east of Luiza.

languages.name: Samba
languages.area: Bandundu Province, north Kasongo-Lunda Territory.

languages.name: Sanga (Democratic Republic of Congo)
languages.area: Katanga Province, north of Likasi, widely dispersed in Lubudi, Mitwaba, and Pweto territories.

languages.name: So (Democratic Republic of Congo)
languages.area: Orientale Province, north of Basoko.

languages.name: Songoora
languages.area: Maniema Province, Punia, Kindu, and Shabunda territories; Gengele in Kindu Territory.

languages.name: Songomeno
languages.area: Kasaï Occidental Province, Dekese Territory.

languages.name: Songo
languages.area: Bandundu Province, Bulungu Territory.

languages.name: Songe
languages.area: Kasaï Oriental Province, between Sankuru and Lualaba rivers, mainly Kabinda zone and east into Katanga Province, Kongolo and Kabolo territories of.

languages.name: Suku
languages.area: South Bandundu Province, west of Feshi, Moanza and Mwela areas.

languages.name: Congo Swahili
languages.area: Widespread in Katanga, Nord-Kivu, Sud-Kivu, and Maniema provinces; southeast Orientale Province.

languages.name: Sere
languages.area: Orientale Province, northeast of Ango, among the Zande [zne]. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Swahili (Coastal)
languages.area: Zanzibar, coastal areas. Also in Burundi, Canada, Kenya, Libya, Mayotte, Mozambique, Oman, Rwanda, Somalia, South Africa, Uganda, United Arab Emirates, United States.

languages.name: Sengele
languages.area: Bandundu Province, west of Lake Mai-Ndombe.

languages.name: Taabwa
languages.area: Katanga Province, on Lake Tanganyika, south of Moba. Also in Zambia.

languages.name: Tagbu
languages.area: Widely scattered.

languages.name: Tembo (Kitembo)
languages.area: Sud-Kivu and Nord-Kivu provinces, Kalehe Territory.

languages.name: Ibali Teke
languages.area: Kwamouth, Masia, Kinshasa, near Banbana on road to Kenga; upstream from Kinshasa to Kwa (Kasaï) River and inland to Fatunda area. Also in Congo.

languages.name: Tiene
languages.area: Bandundu Province, Bolobo area on Congo River and inland savannah and forest.

languages.name: Talinga-Bwisi
languages.area: Democratic Republic of the Congo border, Bwamba County, Bundibugyo District, southwest of Fort Portal, between Albert and Edward lakes, near Kilembe. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Tetela
languages.area: Northern Kasaï Oriental Province.

languages.name: Tembo (Motembo)
languages.area: Equateur Province, Sud Ubangi, Equateur, Budjala and Bomongo districts, Libanza, Bokele, and Bosanga villages on Banga-Melo River; 1 or 2 villages on Mongala River southwest of Akula; Sumba Island.

languages.name: Togbo-Vara Banda
languages.area: Equateur Province, Nord Ubangi, Bosobolo Territory, Badja and Baya town areas, Vongba II and Bandema village areas, on the road as far as Gwara II, and scattered nearby. Also in Central African Republic, Sudan.

languages.name: Vanuma
languages.area: Orientale Province, Ituri District, Irumu Territory, Tchabi Collectivité.

languages.name: Wongo
languages.area: Kasaï Occidental Province, Ilebo and Tshikapa territories; Bandundu Province, Guagu and Idiofa territories, Lubue River area.

languages.name: Sanga (Nigeria)
languages.area: Bauchi state, Toro LGA.

languages.name: Yaka (Democratic Republic of Congo)
languages.area: Bandundu Province (400,000), Popokabaka and Kasongo Lunda territories. Also in Angola.

languages.name: Yela
languages.area: Equateur Province, mainly in Bokungu Territory.

languages.name: Yakoma
languages.area: Kembi and Ouango subprefectures, Ubangi River area and administrative centers. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Yamongeri
languages.area: Equateur Province, south of Congo River.

languages.name: Yango
languages.area: Equateur Province, Kungu and Libenge districts, Esobe River area; Gbendere village.

languages.name: Yansi
languages.area: Bandundu Province, Bulungu Territory, Loange River area.

languages.name: Yombe
languages.area: Western Bas-Congo Province, Mayombe Forest. Also in Angola, Congo.

languages.name: Yulu
languages.area: Ouadda-Djaléi and Ouadda subprefectures. Yulu are in Central African Republic and Sudan; Binga are in Sudan and Democratic Republic of the Congo. Also in Democratic Republic of the Congo, Sudan.

languages.name: Zimba
languages.area: Maniema Province, Kasongo Territory, Mulu and Maringa collectivités.

languages.name: Mfinu
languages.area: Bandundu Province.

languages.name: Mpuono
languages.area: Bandundu Province, Idiofa Territory.

languages.name: Mituku
languages.area: Orientale Province, Ubundu Territory, west of Lualaba River.

languages.name: Mbesa
languages.area: Orientale Province, north Yahuma Territory, south of Congo River.

languages.name: Mbo (Democratic Republic of Congo)
languages.area: Orientale Province, Ituri District, Mambasa Territory, Bombo Collectivité.

languages.name: Mbandja
languages.area: Equateur Province, Sud Ubangi, Nord Ubangi, and west Mongala districts; west, southwest, and east of the Ngbaka [nga]. Also in Central African Republic, Congo.

languages.name: Zande
languages.area: Far north of Orientale Province, Bas-Uele District. Also in Central African Republic, Sudan.
